game.IOStuff

Class IOManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.IOStuff.IOManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EventManager, GameIOManager, LogManager

    public abstract class IOManager
extends Object
    This class is a recorder which will get and record all relevant states in the game. This recorder will also return the relevant states where told to do so. Its main function is to save the game's relevant states to a file, or conversely load the game from a save file. Secondary jobs include printing out game logs, saving high scores, and generating summary reports of changes.

    • Method Detail

      • ensureDirectoryExistance

        public void ensureDirectoryExistance(String directoryName)
        This method ensures the given directory exists. If it exists, it does nothing; if it doesn't exist, it makes it.
        Parameters:
        directoryName - a path to the direectory

      • extractedInfo

        public String extractedInfo(String inputInformation)
        This method is used by various info-parsing functions to parse the relevant information from the relevant strings in the file. Feed in a string, it returns everything after the colon (if present), with spaces stripped from the beginning and end.
        Parameters:
        inputInformation - The string with information to be parsed.
        Returns:
        information the parsed string with the relevant info.

      • getFileName

        public String getFileName()
        Returns the file name.
        Returns:
        name of file

      • load

        public ArrayList<String> load(String fileName)
                       throws IOException
        Given a file name, this method loads all the information in this file as though it were a text file. It then returns this information to the user in the form of an ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        fileName - A String corresponding to the name of the file to be loaded. Recommended format for the file name is: [filename].txt, where [filename] is up to you.
        Returns:
        fileData An ArrayList with all the information in the file, assuming the file loaded up properly.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • save

        public void save(ArrayList<String> stringList,
                 String fileName)
          throws IOException
        Given an ArrayList and a fileName, this method tries to save all of the information in the ArrayList, line by line, into a text file with the same name as the file name.
        Parameters:
        stringList - An ArrayList corresponding to the set of information to be saved into a text file. Note that the information must be in the form of strings.
        fileName - A String corresponding to the name of the file to be saved as. Recommended format: [someFileName].txt, where [someFileName] is whatever one wants.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setFileName

        public void setFileName(String aFileName)
        Sets the file name.
        Parameters:
        aFileName - - The name of the file
